name: Step-up basis of capital gains at death
objective: Under the baseline tax system, unrealized capital gains would be taxed when assets are transferred at death. It would not allow for exempting gains upon transfer of the underlying assets to the heirs. In contrast, capital gains on assets held at the owner’s death are not subject to capital gains tax under current law. The cost basis of the appreciated assets is adjusted to the market value at the owner’s date of death which becomes the basis for the heirs.
